titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Petition to the Postmaster General of Northport 1979.010
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Matthew Gorham
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2011-11-18T14:59-0500

did.unittitle: Petition to the Postmaster General of Northport
did.abstract: A two-page petition to the Postmaster General of Northport, Long Island that requests that the town post office be moved to a more convenient location. The petition also calls for the removal of the postmaster of Northport for incompetence. The petition is dated 1873

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. The item was formally accessioned in 1979.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Petition to the Postmaster General of Northport, 1979.010, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.
